moves.1. e4:
Hello folks, my 2nd annotation of a fun game with an aggressive white.  Your comments will be read and appreciated.

My standard opening move.
moves.1... d5: a surprise play from black.  white isn't sure of black's intent...
moves.2. e5: white passes the pawn, white's thinking of controlling the center.
moves.2... a6 3. d4: white's taken the center for now.
moves.3... Nc6 4. Nf3: at this time: white's goals are 1) defending both pawns 2) looking to setup for kingside castle
moves.4... e6 5. Bd2: white brings dark bishop out to counter 5... Bb4 or 5... Nb4
moves.5... f6 6. c4: white offers to swap pawns.  if white's c pawn is taken, white takes pawn with light bishop and develops it.  If not, white develops another piece... maybe Nb3 or even maybe Qa4
moves.6... fxe5 7. Nxe5: white offers to swap knights.  white's goal here to maintain center and ensure pawn(s) in the e file to keep a defendable defender in front of the king.
moves.8. Qh5+: white was thinking here something along the line of: 8. ... g6 9. Nxg6 hxg6 10. Qxg6+ Kd7 11. cxd5 exd5 12. Qg4+ Ke8 13. Qxd4 Rh4 14. f4 but...
moves.8... Ke7: a surprise, black moves king.  white thought Bg5+ to skewer queen, but then white saw if Bg5+ then 9...Nf6 and black would be safe for the moment... then white saw and played the better Bb4+.  white has a few conditional moves set here.
moves.9. Bb4+ Kf6 10. Ng4#: this might be the most interesting # of my gameknot.com time.  Thank you gameknot and thank you community!  Cheers all.
